      Our range of built in washing machines (or you might also see them called integrated washing machines) will suit every type of household, whether youre constantly keeping on top of the kids uniforms or you love a good gym sesh.

      One of the biggest benefits of a built-in washing machine is that it'll blend in seamlessly with your kitchen design. They sit nicely behind a cupboard door to match your interior and keep your appliance out of sight. It's also worth mentioning that you'll need to make sure you've purchased your cupboard door as part of your kitchen, because it won't come included with your washing machine. 

      Need help choosing?

      So, you've decided integrated is better for you than a freestanding model. Great! The next thing to consider is whether you want any specific features. If you want to be able to switch your machine on from the sofa, look out for WiFi and smartphone connectivity. Or, if your home is open plan, you might want a quiet motor that'll keep the noise down. 

      You can also get integrated washing machines with different programmes, such as Quick Wash cycles, economy wash for saving a few pennies, and steam settings for getting rid of germs and bacteria.

      Energy-efficiency is a big one too weve made plenty of helpful guides if you want to know more about energy symbols or running costs.

      Looking for a particular brand?

      At AO, we have all the leading brands, including Hoover, LG, Hotpoint, Samsung and Bosch. Hoover is a family favourite with lots of low cost models with all the essential features, while LG are known for their intuitive designs and impressive features.

      What capacity will I need?

      Up to 7kg is perfect for small households, while 10kg is recommended for medium-sized households. If youve got a big family and a never-ending pile of laundry, you might want to get a 12kg+ integrated washing machine.

      Check out our washing machine & washer dryer buying guide for more information.

      Measuring for your built-in washing machine

      When choosing a built-in washing machine, youll need to take accurate measurements to make sure it'll fit on delivery day. 

      Designed to fit under a standard countertop, they usually stand at 85cm tall. Youll need to leave a 7cm gap at the back for the water connection too. And because itll be integrated, we recommend checking the measurements of the furniture door as well.

      Have a quick look at our handywashing machine measurement guide if you need help. 

      Installing your built in washing machine

      Your integrated washing machine may need some extra panelling fitted during installation. If you want to remove the faff of installing it yourself, just choose our handy installation service at checkout. We can also take your old appliance away and recycle it for you.

      At AO, weve got a range of freestanding washing machines for battling laundry piles big or small. Theyre full of handy tech and come with different programmes to suit any household.

      The main benefit of choosing freestanding washing machines is that they can fit into most standard kitchen unit spaces, snugly under the countertop. Unlike integrated washing machines, they dont go behind a cupboard door, which is great if you dont mind it on show. You can also install it in any room with a water connection.

      Need a hand choosing the right model?

      If youve decided a freestanding machine is the best fit for your home, the next thing to consider is the features on offer. Fancy being able to pop on a wash from your phone? Look out for models with smartphone connectivity and WiFi. Or, if your washing machine is always disrupting your favourite show, you might want to go with a quiet motor to keep noise to a minimum.

      There are also different wash cycles available, such as economy wash for taking care of your clothes and the energy bills, Quick Wash for a speedy clean, and steam settings that get rid of bacteria and allergens - perfect for those with sensitive skin.

      Being more energy-efficient is a biggie for many of our customers too, so weve put together some handy guides for learning about running costs and energy symbols.

      Looking for your favourite brand?

      We work with plenty of big brands that specialise in freestanding washing machines, such as Bosch, Hoover, Hotpoint, LG, and Samsung. Hoover is one of our most popular brands, as theyve got lots of essential features without a hefty price tag. And because your free standing washing machine will be on display, LG have models with sleek designs and fab features to match.

      What about size?

      As a standard rule, a 7kg capacity drum is great for small households, while 10kg is best for medium to large households. You can also go with an extra-large 12kg+ capacity if youve always got plenty of washing to do.

      Our washing machine & washer dryer buying guide goes into drum sizes in a bit more detail.

      Measuring up for your freestanding washing machine

      Youll need accurate measurements before choosing a machine, as you dont want to be stuck with nowhere to put it on delivery day.

      If youre going to pop it under a worktop, check the width, height, and depth of the space. Youll also want to leave an extra 7cm at the back for the pipes. Most models are 85cm tall and the measurements for each are displayed on our website.

      Placing it somewhere else? If theres nothing above or around your machine, then great - that saves you a job. Just make sure theres a water connection. You can also check out ourwashing machine measurement guide for more tips and tricks.

      Installing your freestanding washing machine

      Installing a new washing machine isnt always easy, especially if you dont know what youre doing. Let our experts do it for you. They can even remove your old appliance and recycle it & sounds great to us. Just add any extras in your basket during checkout.
